intro: Euphoebe macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf euphoebe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically followed by bright red berries. Euphoebe macrophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and unique fruiting display.
